unittitle.value:
F. & M. Schaefer Brewing Company's 
                <emph render="italic">The Last Night at Ebbets Field</emph> scrapbook

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: One photographic scrapbook documenting the last night of Brooklyn Dodgers baseball at Ebbets Field in Brooklyn, New York, on September 24, 1957. The scrapbook was produced by the F. & M. Schaefer Brewing Company for Dodgers owner and president Walter O'Malley. It includes photographs of baseball players, staff, sportscasters, sportswriters, fans, and Schaefer employees. Notable individuals featured in the photographs include Roy Campanella, Carl Erskine, Gil Hodges, Emmett Kelly, Sandy Koufax, Johnny Podres, and Vin Scully.

p.value:
Identification of item, date (if known); F. & M. Schaefer Brewing Company's 
                <emph render="italic">The Last Night at Ebbets Field</emph> scrapbook, 2011.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

The Brooklyn Dodgers were established in 1883 as the Brooklyn Atlantics. Starting in 1913 they played at Ebbets Field, in what was then known as the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn (today known as Crown Heights), where they remained until 1957. The following year the team relocated to Los Angeles, California.

People featured in the photographs include the following: Walt Alston, Roy Campanella, Jerry Doggett, Carl Erskine, John Griffin, Al Helfer, Gil Hodges, Emmett Kelly, Sandy Koufax, Johnny Podres, R.J. Schaefer, Vin Scully, and Dr. Harold Wendler.
